channel.title: Multi-Login Dupe, Help! [DELTA]
channel.description:
Basically, you can login with the same account in capital letters, drop the same items to yourself and the items are duped...
How can I stop people from doing this? Or just stopping people from logging in with capital letters in general? NOTE, this is for Delta.
Please help, thanks.

item.title: Multi-Login Dupe, Help! [DELTA]
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

People here aren’t obligated to help you. The amount of quality help you receive is directly related to how much effort you put in to helping them help you.
It seems your issue’s been solved, so this thread is now closed.

Read full topic

item.title: Multi-Login Dupe, Help! [DELTA]
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

[quote=“arean, post:32, topic:542897”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=661774.msg4424100#msg4424100 date=1399885924]

god damn this is sad how long it’s gone on.

post your client.java to pastebin

You can download stabbingscape 4.1 and see the exact problem I don’t want people to see my client java because its packed and its got things I don’t wanna show but stabbingscape is the base I used

Dude. If you packaged it then the code he would be looking at would be different than the code you would be looking at.

We have gave you the code (more than once). We have told you where to put it (more than once as well). Now we’re (more so Vain_) offering to do it for you. All you have to supply is 1 class. That’s client.java.

I’m going to be blunt, and I’m going to be honest. Whatever is in your source, isn’t good. It’s not top of the line, I can guarantee it. If anything, it’s all reproducible (pretty sure of it). And packaging is nothing. There are plenty of delta sources out there with packaging. Every PI ever has packaging. 95+% (assumed) of any “new” releases that come out have a packaged source. Your code isn’t special. Just post it and move on, this has gone on long enough. We cannot help you anymore, as we have literally done everything we can except for doing it for you.
[/quote]

I fixed it myself. None of the help actually helped and all answers were pretty vague and kinda sh3tty. And shut up. My server may be shit, but it gets 40+ players active daily so shows how much you know idiot. And I bet any server you make won’t even pull 4 players.[/quote]

Are you serious? They gave you the answer.

Your players must be proud to have a developer like yourself.

Read full topic

I’m going to be blunt, and I’m going to be honest. Whatever is in your source, isn’t good. It’s not top of the line, I can guarantee it. If anything, it’s all reproducible (pretty sure of it). And packaging is nothing. There are plenty of delta sources out there with packaging. Every PI ever has packaging. 95+% (assumed) of any “new” releases that come out have a packaged source. Your code isn’t special. Just post it and move on, this has gone on long enough. We cannot help you anymore, as we have literally done everything we can except for doing it for you.[/quote]

I fixed it myself. None of the help actually helped and all answers were pretty vague and kinda sh3tty. And shut up. My server may be shit, but it gets 40+ players active daily so shows how much you know idiot. And I bet any server you make won’t even pull 4 players.

item.title: Multi-Login Dupe, Help! [DELTA]
item.dc:creator: @arean arean
item.description:
@arean wrote:

I tried putting the code Pure_ gave me in my client.java everywhere in the run() method thing but I keep getting 3-2 errors lol sorry guys if I’m sounding like a complete d1ck thanks for all your help everyone I’m trying to learn how to fix this and I’m trying all the solutions but it just won’t work.

If someone could download stabbingscape V4.1 (delete it right after you do this) and just maybe show me the exact place to put it I’d be greatful I worked hard on this server I can’t give up. Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Multi-Login Dupe, Help! [DELTA]
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“arean, post:25, topic:542897”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=661774.msg4423683#msg4423683 date=1399675686]

When they are logging in for the first time, normalize their username, then proceed with character verification e.g.

[code=java]String playerName = in.readString(); // getting the name from the socket

playerName = playerName.toLowerCase().trim(); // our hacky fix

verify(playerName); // regular char verification logic[/code]

Can someone tell me if this code will solve my problem? And if it doesn’t can someone come up with a code to block people from logging in with capital letters (and compatible with Delta!).

I just told you…
[/quote]

Some are saying the code won’t work, some are saying it will. Is there not a concrete answer? And if it doesn’t can someone come up with a code for my problem for delta?[/quote]
PURE JUST GAVE YOU THE ANSWER

[quote=“matzie, post:23, topic:542897”]Your problem is at the top of the run() method in client.java, as it is with all other 317 (pre-PI servers).
where it says playerName = steam.readString() your issue lies.
instead make it

String tempName = stream.readString();
if (PlayerHandler.isPlayerOnline(tempName) || PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(tempName) != -1) {
 returnCode = 7;//already online - i think
 savefile = false;
}

this may not be the name of your fields, but please tell me you have the common sense to be able to change the name of a variable to the ones your server has.[/quote]
AND THIS DUDE JUST TOLD YOU EXACTLY WHAT TO DO

Read full topic

item.title: Multi-Login Dupe, Help! [DELTA]
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

Your problem is at the top of the run() method in client.java, as it is with all other 317 (pre-PI servers).
where it says playerName = steam.readString() your issue lies.
instead make it

String tempName = stream.readString();
if (PlayerHandler.isPlayerOnline(tempName) || PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(tempName) != -1) {
 returnCode = 7;//already online - i think
 savefile = false;
}

this may not be the name of your fields, but please tell me you have the common sense to be able to change the name of a variable to the ones your server has.

Read full topic

item.title: Multi-Login Dupe, Help! [DELTA]
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“arean, post:17, topic:542897”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=661774.msg4423616#msg4423616 date=1399626596]

If that’s the case, can someone give me some actual productive help that will actually solve my problem instead of just stating the problem which I already mentioned…

No one uses an out dated delta source (Like you’re using). Most that do use delta use one of the more recent releases. Where it’s packaged, documented (some are), and have less bugs (aka this one). We don’t know what delta you’re using. We just know it’s a delta.
Basically ALL pi’s have the same structure and filenames, so they’re easy to work with (in terms of supplying information).
Your server is piled into mostly one file.
Search for where it sends the login information (I guess it actually receives it but still). then add the check there.
The login area will have returnCodes.
[/quote]

I’m using stabbingscape V4.1. I had made a mistake with the coding a while back and accidently deleted the code to prevent this dupe from happening but I forgot what I had done to do this.[/quote]
if your playerhandler has an isPlayerOnline() method i would make use of it… That has to be the simplest way to word it.

Honestly, you should have some background in computer programming before attempting to make a private server. Granted i did start here having known nothing, and now i have been here since 2011. The more time you spend reading through your server’s source code the more you will understand what is happening. I suggest reading through all of them and attempting to get a feel of what your server has for capabilities, and to see how garbled it is.

I started making modglow commands with pimpscape lol, aah the good ole’ days.

Read full topic

item.title: Multi-Login Dupe, Help! [DELTA]
item.dc:creator: @arean arean
item.description:
@arean wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:16, topic:542897”][quote author=arean link=topic=661774.msg4423614#msg4423614 date=1399623223]
If that’s the case, can someone give me some actual productive help that will actually solve my problem instead of just stating the problem which I already mentioned…
[/quote]
No one uses an out dated delta source (Like you’re using). Most that do use delta use one of the more recent releases. Where it’s packaged, documented (some are), and have less bugs (aka this one). We don’t know what delta you’re using. We just know it’s a delta.
Basically ALL pi’s have the same structure and filenames, so they’re easy to work with (in terms of supplying information).
Your server is piled into mostly one file.
Search for where it sends the login information (I guess it actually receives it but still). then add the check there.
The login area will have returnCodes.[/quote]

I’m using stabbingscape V4.1. I had made a mistake with the coding a while back and accidently deleted the code to prevent this dupe from happening but I forgot what I had done to do this.

Read full topic

arean:

If that’s the case, can someone give me some actual productive help that will actually solve my problem instead of just stating the problem which I already mentioned…

No one uses an out dated delta source (Like you’re using). Most that do use delta use one of the more recent releases. Where it’s packaged, documented (some are), and have less bugs (aka this one). We don’t know what delta you’re using. We just know it’s a delta.
Basically ALL pi’s have the same structure and filenames, so they’re easy to work with (in terms of supplying information).
Your server is piled into mostly one file.
Search for where it sends the login information (I guess it actually receives it but still). then add the check there.
The login area will have returnCodes.

item.title: Multi-Login Dupe, Help! [DELTA]
item.dc:creator: @arean arean
item.description:
@arean wrote:

[quote=“Strucker, post:14, topic:542897”][quote author=arean link=topic=661774.msg4423536#msg4423536 date=1399585279]

Basically, you can login with the same account in capital letters, drop the same items to yourself and the items are duped…

How can I stop people from doing this? Or just stopping people from logging in with capital letters in general? NOTE, this is for Delta.

Please help, thanks.

playerName.contains("[0-9a-zA-Z ]{3,12}") or anyone here who is good with regex can do it :P

Can you tell me what this code will do? Does it stop capital letters from logging in and if so can you please tell me where I have to put it?

Nothing. That’s just an example of regex.
Do what Pure_ said…

Can someone just tell me from a noob point of view, what I need to put in my search in the client.java file so I can copy and paste that code pure_ gave me?
[/quote]The code wont just work, it was an example, and yeah, perhaps its somewhere in client.java[/quote]

If that’s the case, can someone give me some actual productive help that will actually solve my problem instead of just stating the problem which I already mentioned…

Read full topic
